meanings.definition: Skillful or clever in using the hands or mind.
meanings.sent1: She was adroit at solving puzzles with her quick mind.
meanings.sent2: The adroit chef effortlessly chopped the vegetables with skillful precision.
meanings.sent3: The adroit magician made the cards disappear with clever sleight of hand.
meanings.sent4: Her adroit fingers danced across the piano keys like a skilled artist.
meanings.sent5: The adroit surgeon performed the delicate surgery with remarkable skill.

meanings.definition: Quick or skillful in action or thought.
meanings.sent1: He made an adroit decision under pressure, showing quick thinking.
meanings.sent2: The adroit athlete swiftly dodged the defenders on the field.
meanings.sent3: The adroit detective solved the case in record time with clever deductions.
meanings.sent4: Her adroit maneuvering in the negotiation room impressed everyone.
meanings.sent5: The adroit student aced the exam with his quick grasp of the material.
